results.title: Only 9 Trials in 9 Months: Virus Wreaks Havoc on N.Y.C. Courts
results.abstract: The coronavirus has upended criminal trials in the city, infiltrating courtrooms in ways that threaten both health and justice.
results.byline: By Nicole Hong and Jan Ransom

multimedia.caption: In October, Demetre Cornish (left) became the first defendant to stand trial in State Supreme Court in Manhattan since the pandemic began.
multimedia.copyright: Jefferson Siegel for The New York Times
